body_html:
Yes that's true.
It seems that what @mrry mentionned in #15694 (comment) can permit to avoid the overhead. If I add the cache comment between the batch and the repeat comment as follows :

   dataset_shuffle = dataset_shuffle.batch(batch_size)
   dataset_shuffle = dataset_shuffle.cache() 
   dataset_shuffle = dataset_shuffle.repeat()
body_text:
Yes that's true.
It seems that what @mrry mentionned in #15694 (comment) can permit to avoid the overhead. If I add the cache comment between the batch and the repeat comment as follows :
   dataset_shuffle = dataset_shuffle.batch(batch_size)
   dataset_shuffle = dataset_shuffle.cache() 
   dataset_shuffle = dataset_shuffle.repeat()
body:
Yes that's true.
It seems that what @mrry mentionned in [#15694 (comment)](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/15694#issuecomment-354377649) can permit to avoid the overhead. If I add the cache comment between the batch and the repeat comment as follows : 
```
   dataset_shuffle = dataset_shuffle.batch(batch_size)
   dataset_shuffle = dataset_shuffle.cache() 
   dataset_shuffle = dataset_shuffle.repeat() 
```
